name: UK Spend Publishing Dashboard
pitch: How are government departments living up to their commitments to publish timely, high quality data on spending?
context:
The UK government has clear processes for the publication of over 25k spend data. These are documented in [this document puvlished by HM Treasury](https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/198197/Guidance_for_publishing_spend_over__25k.pdf). Based on this document, we've identified all 25k spend documents published on [data.gov.uk](https://data.gov.uk), and assessed them according to the following criteria:

- Are the tabular data files accessible at the provided URL?
- Are the tabular data files themselves structurally valid?
- Do the data files conform to the HM Treasury regulations for publishing 25K spend data?
